Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend the movie "A Tale of Two Cities" by Charles Dickens.
The story revolves around two men who are brought together due to circumstances beyond their control. One man is a wealthy and influential Londoner named Charles Darnay; the other man is a Frenchman named Jean Valjeans, who has been sent from France to England to help Charles Darnay in his charitable work with the French colony of St. Helens.
Through various twists and turns, the two men become adversaries, as they both fight for their own ideals and goals.
In the end, it is Charles Darnay who emerges victorious, thanks in large part to the invaluable assistance provided by Jean Valjeans.

1. "Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs" (1978) - Directed by Peter Weir and based on the children's book by Ray Bradbury. The movie tells the story of a local scientist who invents a machine that can make food fall from the sky. However, when a French Formula One driver makes his way up the ladder, Ricky Bobby's talent and devotion are put to the test.
2. "Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby" (2006) - Directed by Jeff Rosenthal and based on the children's book by Ray Bradbury. The movie tells the story of an ordinary LEGO construction worker, thought to be the prophesied as  "special", is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil tyrant from gluing the LEGO universe into eternal stasis.
